intro: Acrophorus goudotianus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces showy, clustered flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white, which bloom throughout the year under proper care. Its leaves are velvety and often have a distinctive waxy texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Acrophorus goudotianus thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
